alert.note: Alert for Harlan (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 19 at 3:10AM EDT until May 19 at 3:45AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 AM EDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN HARLAN COUNTY... At 309 AM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Mary Alice, or near just southwest of Harlan, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe storm will be near... Lenarve around 315 AM EDT. Martins Fork Lake around 320 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of this severe thunderstorm include Crummies. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
